CONJUGATES: more numerous | most numerous | numerously (adv) | numerousness (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin numerus ('number') via Old French nombreus, combined with the suffix -ous (meaning 'full of').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: a word naming an attribute of a noun, typically used to modify it.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 数量很多的; 众多的; 不胜枚举的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The committee received numerous complaints regarding the quality of service.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 委员会收到了许多关于服务质量的投诉。

REGISTER: Standard; used across formal and general contexts.
